oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Continuous nickel electroplating of carbon fibres and Weibull analysis of their tensile strengths
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SONI, PR
RAJAN, TV
RAMAKRISHNAN, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: nickel
carbon fibres
electroplating
tensile strengths
weibull analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Set-up for continuous electrolytic nickel plating of carbon fibres (Torayca T 300, 3000-50B) has been designed and fabricated. In the process, the sizing material from the carbon fibre tow was removed by acetone treatment and the fibre surfaces were activated with 0.5 wt % PdCl2 acidic solution. Plating was then carried out under optimized conditions using standard Watt's bath. Optical and Scanning electron microscopy have shown that the coating is of uniform thickness and coherent. The fibres were coated with a coating thickness ranging from 0.08 mu m to 0.83 mu m. Weibull analysis of tensile strengths of the single fibres in as received, sizing-removed and nickel-coated conditions was carried out.
